You also </span><span style="white-space: pre-wrap;">can configure the virtual network to use </span><span style="white-space: pre-wrap;">either an internal or an external DNS server.</span></span><br></p>" style="text;html=1;whiteSpace=wrap;overflow=hidden;rounded=0;fontFamily=Helvetica;fontSize=11;fontColor=default;labelBackgroundColor=default;strokeWidth=6;fillColor=none;strokeColor=default;perimeterSpacing=14;" vertex="1" parent="1"> <mxGeometry x="218" y="210" width="270" height="140" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="thJnnxPs0yN4tjYQE-aY-97" style="edgeStyle=orthogonalEdgeStyle;shape=connector;curved=0;rounded=1;orthogonalLoop=1;jettySize=auto;html=1;strokeColor=default;strokeWidth=3;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;fontFamily=Helvetica;fontSize=11;fontColor=default;labelBackgroundColor=default;endArrow=classic;flowAnimation=1;" edge="1" parent="1" source="thJnnxPs0yN4tjYQE-aY-72" target="thJnnxPs0yN4tjYQE-aY-73"> <mxGeometry relative="1" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="thJnnxPs0yN4tjYQE-aY-72" value="<h1 style="text-align: center; margin-top: 0px;"><span style="caret-color: rgb(31, 31, 31); color: rgb(31, 31, 31); font-family: Verdana; font-size: 12px; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: rgb(251, 251, 251);">Internet communications</span><br></h1><p><span style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);"><span style="white-space: pre-wrap;">You can enable incoming </span><span style="white-space: pre-wrap;">connections from the internet by </span><span style="white-space: pre-wrap;">assigning a public IP address to </span><span style="white-space: pre-wrap;">an Azure resource, or putting </span><span style="white-space: pre-wrap;">the resource behind a public </span><span style="white-space: pre-wrap;">load balancer.</span></span><br></p>" style="text;html=1;whiteSpace=wrap;overflow=hidden;rounded=0;fontFamily=Helvetica;fontSize=11;fontColor=default;labelBackgroundColor=default;strokeWidth=6;fillColor=none;strokeColor=default;perimeterSpacing=14;" vertex="1" parent="1"> <mxGeometry x="218" y="420" width="270" height="100" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="thJnnxPs0yN4tjYQE-aY-73" value="<h1 style="text-align: center; margin-top: 0px;"><span style="caret-color: rgb(31, 31, 31); color: rgb(31, 31, 31); font-family: Verdana; font-size: 12px; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: rgb(251, 251, 251);">Between Azure resources</span><br></h1><p dir="ltr"><span style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);"><span style="text-wrap-mode: wrap;">1.&nbsp;</span><span style="white-space: pre-wrap;">Virtual networks can connect not only VMs but other Azure </span><span style="white-space: pre-wrap;">resources, such as the App Service Environment for Power </span><span style="white-space: pre-wrap;">Apps, Azure Kubernetes Service, and Azure virtual machine </span><span style="white-space: pre-wrap;">scale sets.</span><br></span></p><p dir="ltr"><span style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);"><span style="white-space: pre-wrap;">2. Service endpoints can connect to other Azure resource </span><span style="white-space: pre-wrap;">types, such as Azure SQL databases and storage accounts. </span><span style="white-space: pre-wrap;">This approach enables you to link multiple Azure resources </span><span style="white-space: pre-wrap;">to virtual networks to improve security and provide optimal </span><span style="white-space: pre-wrap;">routing between resources.</span></span></p>" style="text;html=1;whiteSpace=wrap;overflow=hidden;rounded=0;fontFamily=Helvetica;fontSize=11;fontColor=default;labelBackgroundColor=default;strokeWidth=6;fillColor=none;strokeColor=default;perimeterSpacing=14;" vertex="1" parent="1"> <mxGeometry x="218" y="590" width="270" height="203.75" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="thJnnxPs0yN4tjYQE-aY-76" value="<h1 style="text-align: center; margin-top: 0px;"><span style="caret-color: rgb(31, 31, 31); color: rgb(31, 31, 31); font-family: Verdana; font-size: 12px; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: rgb(251, 251, 251);">Communication with onprem resources</span><br></h1><p dir="ltr"><span style="caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);">1. Point-to-site virtual private network connections are from a computer outside your organization back into your corporate network. In this case, the client computer initiates an encrypted VPN connection to connect to the Azure virtual network.</span></p><div><span style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);"><font size="2" face="Segoe UI, SegoeUI, Helvetica Neue, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif"><span style="caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230);"><br></span></font><span style="caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px;">2. Site-to-site virtual private networks link your on-premises VPN device or gateway to the Azure VPN gateway in a virtual network. In effect, the devices in Azure can appear as being on the local network. The connection is encrypted and works over the internet.</span></span></div><div><span style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);"><font size="2" face="Segoe UI, SegoeUI, Helvetica Neue, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif"><span style="caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230);"><br></span></font><span style="caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px;">3. Azure ExpressRoute provides a dedicated private connectivity to Azure that doesn't travel over the internet. ExpressRoute is useful for environments where you need greater bandwidth and even higher levels of security.</span></span></div>" style="text;html=1;whiteSpace=wrap;overflow=hidden;rounded=0;fontFamily=Helvetica;fontSize=11;fontColor=default;labelBackgroundColor=default;strokeWidth=6;fillColor=none;strokeColor=default;perimeterSpacing=14;" edge="1" parent="1" source="thJnnxPs0yN4tjYQE-aY-79" target="thJnnxPs0yN4tjYQE-aY-111"> <mxGeometry relative="1" as="geometry"> <Array as="points"> <mxPoint x="837" y="140" /> <mxPoint x="2032" y="140" /> </Array> </mxGeometry> </mxCell> <mxCell id="thJnnxPs0yN4tjYQE-aY-79" value="<h1 style="margin-top: 0px;"><span style="caret-color: rgb(31, 31, 31); color: rgb(31, 31, 31); font-family: Verdana; font-size: 12px; text-align: center; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: rgb(251, 251, 251);">Communication between resources</span><br></h1>" style="text;html=1;whiteSpace=wrap;overflow=hidden;rounded=0;fontFamily=Helvetica;fontSize=11;fontColor=default;labelBackgroundColor=default;strokeWidth=6;fillColor=none;strokeColor=default;perimeterSpacing=14;" vertex="1" parent="1"> <mxGeometry x="712" y="25" width="250" height="50" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="thJnnxPs0yN4tjYQE-aY-88" value="<h1 style="text-align: center; margin-top: 0px;"><span style="caret-color: rgb(31, 31, 31); color: rgb(31, 31, 31); font-family: Verdana; font-size: 12px; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: rgb(251, 251, 251);">Filter network traffic</span><br></h1><p style="box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;"><font style="font-size: 11px;">1. Azure virtual networks enable you to filter traffic between subnets by using the following approaches:</font></p><p style="box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;">2.Network security groups are Azure resources that can contain multiple inbound and outbound security rules. You can define these rules to allow or block traffic, based on factors such as source and destination IP address, port, and protocol.</p><p style="box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;">3.Network virtual appliances are specialized VMs that can be compared to a hardened network appliance. A network virtual appliance carries out a particular network function, such as running a firewall or performing wide area network (WAN) optimization.</p>" style="text;html=1;whiteSpace=wrap;overflow=hidden;rounded=0;fontFamily=Helvetica;fontSize=11;fontColor=default;labelBackgroundColor=default;strokeWidth=6;fillColor=none;strokeColor=default;perimeterSpacing=14;" vertex="1" parent="1"> <mxGeometry x="699" y="212" width="270" height="253" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="thJnnxPs0yN4tjYQE-aY-91" value="<h1 style="text-align: center; margin-top: 0px;"><span style="caret-color: rgb(31, 31, 31); color: rgb(31, 31, 31); font-family: Verdana; font-size: 12px; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: rgb(251, 251, 251);">Route network traffic</span><br></h1><p style="box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12px;"><font style="font-size: 12px;">1. Azure routes traffic between subnets on any connected virtual networks, on-premises networks, and the internet. You also can control routing and override those settings, as follows:</font></p><p style="box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12px;">2. Route tables allow you to define rules about how traffic should be directed. You can create custom route tables that control how packets are routed between subnets.</p><p style="box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12px;">3. Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) works with Azure VPN gateways, Azure Route Server, or Azure ExpressRoute to propagate on-premises BGP routes to Azure virtual networks.<br></p>" style="text;html=1;whiteSpace=wrap;overflow=hidden;rounded=0;fontFamily=Helvetica;fontSize=11;fontColor=default;labelBackgroundColor=default;strokeWidth=6;fillColor=none;strokeColor=default;perimeterSpacing=14;" vertex="1" parent="1"> <mxGeometry x="699" y="524" width="270" height="264" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="thJnnxPs0yN4tjYQE-aY-93" value="<h1 style="text-align: center; margin-top: 0px;"><font face="Verdana" color="#1f1f1f"><span style="caret-color: rgb(31, 31, 31); font-size: 12px; white-space-collapse: preserve; background-color: rgb(251, 251, 251);">Connected virtual </span><span style="caret-color: rgb(31, 31, 31); font-size: 12px; white-space-collapse: preserve;">network</span></font></h1><p style="box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12px;"><font style="font-size: 12px;">You can link virtual networks together by using virtual network peering. Peering allows two virtual networks to connect directly to each other. Network traffic between peered networks is private, and travels on the Microsoft backbone network, never entering the public internet. Peering enables resources in each virtual network to communicate with each other. These virtual networks can be in separate regions. This feature allows you to create a global interconnected network through Azure.</font></p><p style="box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12px;"><font style="font-size: 12px;">User-defined routes (UDR) allow you to control the routing tables between subnets within a virtual network or between virtual networks. This allows for greater control over network traffic flow<font color="#e6e6e6">.</font></font></p>" style="text;html=1;whiteSpace=wrap;overflow=hidden;rounded=0;fontFamily=Helvetica;fontSize=11;fontColor=default;labelBackgroundColor=default;strokeWidth=6;fillColor=none;strokeColor=default;perimeterSpacing=14;" /> </Array> </mxGeometry> </mxCell> <mxCell id="thJnnxPs0yN4tjYQE-aY-101" style="edgeStyle=orthogonalEdgeStyle;shape=connector;curved=0;rounded=1;orthogonalLoop=1;jettySize=auto;html=1;entryX=0.5;entryY=0.062;entryDx=0;entryDy=0;entryPerimeter=0;strokeColor=default;strokeWidth=3;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;fontFamily=Helvetica;fontSize=11;fontColor=default;labelBackgroundColor=default;endArrow=classic;flowAnimation=1;" style="edgeStyle=orthogonalEdgeStyle;shape=connector;curved=0;rounded=1;orthogonalLoop=1;jettySize=auto;html=1;entryX=0.49;entryY=0.043;entryDx=0;entryDy=0;entryPerimeter=0;strokeColor=default;strokeWidth=3;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;fontFamily=Helvetica;fontSize=11;fontColor=default;labelBackgroundColor=default;endArrow=classic;flowAnimation=1;" edge="1" parent="1" source="thJnnxPs0yN4tjYQE-aY-91" target="thJnnxPs0yN4tjYQE-aY-93"> <mxGeometry relative="1" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="thJnnxPs0yN4tjYQE-aY-108" style="edgeStyle=orthogonalEdgeStyle;shape=connector;curved=0;rounded=1;orthogonalLoop=1;jettySize=auto;html=1;entryX=0.5;entryY=0;entryDx=0;entryDy=0;strokeColor=default;strokeWidth=3;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;fontFamily=Helvetica;fontSize=11;fontColor=default;labelBackgroundColor=default;endArrow=classic;flowAnimation=1;" edge="1" parent="1" source="thJnnxPs0yN4tjYQE-aY-105" target="thJnnxPs0yN4tjYQE-aY-107"> <mxGeometry relative="1" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="thJnnxPs0yN4tjYQE-aY-105" value="<h1 style="margin-top: 0px;"><font style="font-size: 12px;">Virtual private network</font></h1><div><font style="font-size: 12px;"><p style="font-size: 11px; text-align: left; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;"><span style="font-size: 16px; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);">A virtual private network (VPN) uses an encrypted tunnel within another network. VPNs are typically deployed to connect two or more trusted private networks to one another over an untrusted network (typically the public internet). Traffic is encrypted while traveling over the untrusted network to prevent eavesdropping or other attacks. VPNs can enable networks to safely and securely share sensitive information.</span><br></p><div><br></div></font></div>" style="text;html=1;whiteSpace=wrap;overflow=hidden;rounded=0;fontFamily=Helvetica;fontSize=11;fontColor=default;labelBackgroundColor=default;strokeWidth=6;fillColor=none;strokeColor=default;perimeterSpacing=14;align=center;" vertex="1" parent="1"> <mxGeometry x="1188" y="210" width="270" height="315" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="thJnnxPs0yN4tjYQE-aY-107" value="<h1 style="margin-top: 0px;"><span style="font-size: 12px;">VPN gateway</span></h1><div><font style="font-size: 12px;"><p style="text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word;">A VPN gateway is a type of virtual network gateway. Azure VPN Gateway instances are deployed in a dedicated subnet of the virtual network and enable the following connectivity:</p><ul style="text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 16px 0px 16px 38px; padding: 0px; list-style: none;"><li style="box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; outline-style: none; outline-width: 0px; list-style: outside;">Connect on-premises datacenters to virtual networks through a site-to-site connection.</li><li style="box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; outline-style: none; outline-width: 0px; list-style: outside;">Connect individual devices to virtual networks through a point-to-site connection.</li><li style="box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; outline-style: none; outline-width: 0px; list-style: outside;">Connect virtual networks to other virtual networks through a network-to-network connection.</li></ul><p style="text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word;">All data transfer is encrypted inside a private tunnel as it crosses the internet. You can deploy only one VPN gateway in each virtual network. However, you can use one gateway to connect to multiple locations, which includes other virtual networks or on-premises datacenters.</p><p style="text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word;">When setting up a VPN gateway, you must specify the type of VPN - either policy-based or route-based. The primary distinction between these two types is how they determine which traffic needs encryption. In Azure, regardless of the VPN type, the method of authentication employed is a preshared key.</p><ul style="text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 16px 0px 16px 38px; padding: 0px; list-style: none;"><li style="box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; outline-style: none; outline-width: 0px; list-style: outside;">Policy-based VPN gateways specify statically the IP address of packets that should be encrypted through each tunnel. This type of device evaluates every data packet against those sets of IP addresses to choose the tunnel where that packet is going to be sent through.</li><li style="box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; outline-style: none; outline-width: 0px; list-style: outside;">In Route-based gateways, IPSec tunnels are modeled as a network interface or virtual tunnel interface. IP routing (either static routes or dynamic routing protocols) decides which one of these tunnel interfaces to use when sending each packet. Route-based VPNs are the preferred connection method for on-premises devices. They're more resilient to topology changes such as the creation of new subnets.</li></ul><p style="text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word;">Use a route-based VPN gateway if you need any of the following types of connectivity:</p><ul style="text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 16px 0px 16px 38px; padding: 0px; list-style: none;"><li style="box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; outline-style: none; outline-width: 0px; list-style: outside;">Connections between virtual networks</li><li style="box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; outline-style: none; outline-width: 0px; list-style: outside;">Point-to-site connections</li><li style="box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; outline-style: none; outline-width: 0px; list-style: outside;">Multisite connections</li><li style="box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; outline-style: none; outline-width: 0px; list-style: outside;">Coexistence with an Azure ExpressRoute gateway</li></ul><h2 style="text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 32px 0px 12px; padding: 0px; font-size: clamp(1.59375rem, 18.7895px + 1.39803vw, 2.125rem); line-height: 1.3;" id="high-availability-scenarios">High-availability scenarios</h2><p style="text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word;">If you’re configuring a VPN to keep your information safe, you also want to be sure that it’s a highly available and fault tolerant VPN configuration. There are a few ways to maximize the resiliency of your VPN gateway.</p><h3 style="text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 30px 0px 18px; padding: 0px; font-size: clamp(1.3125rem, 15.4737px + 1.15132vw, 1.75rem); line-height: 1.3;" id="activestandby">Active/standby</h3><p style="text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word;">By default, VPN gateways are deployed as two instances in an active/standby configuration, even if you only see one VPN gateway resource in Azure. When planned maintenance or unplanned disruption affects the active instance, the standby instance automatically assumes responsibility for connections without any user intervention. Connections are interrupted during this failover, but they typically restore within a few seconds for planned maintenance and within 90 seconds for unplanned disruptions.</p><h3 style="text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 30px 0px 18px; padding: 0px; font-size: clamp(1.3125rem, 15.4737px + 1.15132vw, 1.75rem); line-height: 1.3;" id="activeactive">Active/active</h3><p style="text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word;">With the introduction of support for the BGP routing protocol, you can also deploy VPN gateways in an active/active configuration. In this configuration, you assign a unique public IP address to each instance. You then create separate tunnels from the on-premises device to each IP address. You can extend the high availability by deploying an additional VPN device on-premises.</p><h3 style="text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 30px 0px 18px; padding: 0px; font-size: clamp(1.3125rem, 15.4737px + 1.15132vw, 1.75rem); line-height: 1.3;" id="expressroute-failover">ExpressRoute failover</h3><p style="text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word;">Another high-availability option is to configure a VPN gateway as a secure failover path for ExpressRoute connections. ExpressRoute circuits have resiliency built in. However, they aren't immune to physical problems that affect the cables delivering connectivity or outages that affect the complete ExpressRoute location. In high-availability scenarios, where there's risk associated with an outage of an ExpressRoute circuit, you can also provision a VPN gateway that uses the internet as an alternative method of connectivity. In this way, you can ensure there's always a connection to the virtual networks.</p><h3 style="text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 30px 0px 18px; padding: 0px; font-size: clamp(1.3125rem, 15.4737px + 1.15132vw, 1.75rem); line-height: 1.3;" id="zone-redundant-gateways">Zone-redundant gateways</h3><p style="text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word;">In regions that support availability zones, VPN gateways and ExpressRoute gateways can be deployed in a zone-redundant configuration. This configuration brings resiliency, scalability, and higher availability to virtual network gateways. Deploying gateways in Azure availability zones physically and logically separates gateways within a region while protecting your on-premises network connectivity to Azure from zone-level failures. These gateways require different gateway stock keeping units (SKUs) and use Standard public IP addresses instead of Basic public IP addresses.</p><p style="font-size: 11px; text-align: left; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;"><br style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0);" class="Apple-interchange-newline"></p><div style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-style: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: auto; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; widows: auto; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; text-decoration: none; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 0px auto; padding: 0px; max-width: 960px;" class="modular-content-container is-hidden-portrait" id="next-section"></div><div><br></div></font></div>" style="text;html=1;whiteSpace=wrap;overflow=hidden;rounded=0;fontFamily=Helvetica;fontSize=11;fontColor=default;labelBackgroundColor=default;strokeWidth=6;fillColor=none;strokeColor=default;perimeterSpacing=14;align=center;" vertex="1" parent="1"> <mxGeometry x="1188" y="595" width="270" height="2143" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="thJnnxPs0yN4tjYQE-aY-109" value="<h1 style="margin-top: 0px;"><span style="font-size: 12px;">Express route</span></h1><div><font style="font-size: 12px;"><p style="font-size: 11px; text-align: left; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;"><span style="font-size: 16px; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);">&nbsp;</span><br></p><div><span style="caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: start;">Azure ExpressRoute lets you extend your on-premises networks into the Microsoft cloud over a private connection, with the help of a connectivity provider. This connection is called an ExpressRoute Circuit. With ExpressRoute, you can establish connections to Microsoft cloud services, such as Microsoft Azure and Microsoft 365. This feature allows you to connect offices, datacenters, or other facilities to the Microsoft cloud. Each location would have its own ExpressRoute circuit.</span><br></div></font><p style="font-size: 16px; text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;">Connectivity can be from an any-to-any (IP VPN) network, a point-to-point Ethernet network, or a virtual cross-connection through a connectivity provider at a colocation facility. ExpressRoute connections don't go over the public Internet. This setup allows ExpressRoute connections to offer more reliability, faster speeds, consistent latencies, and higher security than typical connections over the Internet.</p><h2 style="text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 32px 0px 12px; padding: 0px; font-size: clamp(1.59375rem, 18.7895px + 1.39803vw, 2.125rem); line-height: 1.3; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;" id="features-and-benefits-of-expressroute">Features and benefits of ExpressRoute</h2><p style="font-size: 16px; text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;">There are several benefits to using ExpressRoute as the connection service between Azure and on-premises networks.</p><ul style="font-size: 16px; text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 16px 0px 16px 38px; padding: 0px; list-style: none; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;"><li style="box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; outline-style: none; outline-width: 0px; list-style: outside;">Connectivity to Microsoft cloud services across all regions in the geopolitical region.</li><li style="box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; outline-style: none; outline-width: 0px; list-style: outside;">Global connectivity to Microsoft services across all regions with the ExpressRoute Global Reach.</li><li style="box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; outline-style: none; outline-width: 0px; list-style: outside;">Dynamic routing between your network and Microsoft via Border Gateway Protocol (BGP).</li><li style="box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; outline-style: none; outline-width: 0px; list-style: outside;">Built-in redundancy in every peering location for higher reliability.</li></ul><h3 style="text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 30px 0px 18px; padding: 0px; font-size: clamp(1.3125rem, 15.4737px + 1.15132vw, 1.75rem); line-height: 1.3; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;" id="connectivity-to-microsoft-cloud-services">Connectivity to Microsoft cloud services</h3><p style="font-size: 16px; text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;">ExpressRoute enables direct access to the following services in all regions:</p><ul style="font-size: 16px; text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 16px 0px 16px 38px; padding: 0px; list-style: none; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;"><li style="box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; outline-style: none; outline-width: 0px; list-style: outside;">Microsoft Office 365</li><li style="box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; outline-style: none; outline-width: 0px; list-style: outside;">Microsoft Dynamics 365</li><li style="box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; outline-style: none; outline-width: 0px; list-style: outside;">Azure compute services, such as Azure Virtual Machines</li><li style="box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; outline-style: none; outline-width: 0px; list-style: outside;">Azure cloud services, such as Azure Cosmos DB and Azure Storage</li></ul><h3 style="text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 30px 0px 18px; padding: 0px; font-size: clamp(1.3125rem, 15.4737px + 1.15132vw, 1.75rem); line-height: 1.3; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;" id="global-connectivity">Global connectivity</h3><p style="font-size: 16px; text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;">You can enable ExpressRoute Global Reach to exchange data across your on-premises sites by connecting your ExpressRoute circuits. For example, say you had an office in Asia and a datacenter in Europe, both with ExpressRoute circuits connecting them to the Microsoft network. You could use ExpressRoute Global Reach to connect those two facilities, allowing them to communicate without transferring data over the public internet.</p><h3 style="text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 30px 0px 18px; padding: 0px; font-size: clamp(1.3125rem, 15.4737px + 1.15132vw, 1.75rem); line-height: 1.3; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;" id="dynamic-routing">Dynamic routing</h3><p style="font-size: 16px; text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;">ExpressRoute uses the BGP. BGP is used to exchange routes between on-premises networks and resources running in Azure. This protocol enables dynamic routing between your on-premises network and services running in the Microsoft cloud.</p><h3 style="text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 30px 0px 18px; padding: 0px; font-size: clamp(1.3125rem, 15.4737px + 1.15132vw, 1.75rem); line-height: 1.3; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;" id="built-in-redundancy">Built-in redundancy</h3><p style="font-size: 16px; text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;">Each connectivity provider uses redundant devices to ensure that connections established with Microsoft are highly available. You can configure multiple circuits to complement this feature.</p><h2 style="text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 32px 0px 12px; padding: 0px; font-size: clamp(1.59375rem, 18.7895px + 1.39803vw, 2.125rem); line-height: 1.3; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;" id="expressroute-connectivity-models">ExpressRoute connectivity models</h2><p style="font-size: 16px; text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;">ExpressRoute supports four models that you can use to connect your on-premises network to the Microsoft cloud:</p><ul style="font-size: 16px; text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 16px 0px 16px 38px; padding: 0px; list-style: none; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;"><li style="box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; outline-style: none; outline-width: 0px; list-style: outside;">CloudExchange colocation</li><li style="box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; outline-style: none; outline-width: 0px; list-style: outside;">Point-to-point Ethernet connection</li><li style="box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; outline-style: none; outline-width: 0px; list-style: outside;">Any-to-any connection</li><li style="box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; outline-style: none; outline-width: 0px; list-style: outside;">Directly from ExpressRoute sites</li></ul><h3 style="text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 30px 0px 18px; padding: 0px; font-size: clamp(1.3125rem, 15.4737px + 1.15132vw, 1.75rem); line-height: 1.3; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;" id="colocation-at-a-cloud-exchange">Colocation at a cloud exchange</h3><p style="font-size: 16px; text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;">Colocation refers to your datacenter, office, or other facility being physically colocated at a cloud exchange, such as an ISP. If your facility is colocated at a cloud exchange, you can request a virtual cross-connect to the Microsoft cloud.</p><h3 style="text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 30px 0px 18px; padding: 0px; font-size: clamp(1.3125rem, 15.4737px + 1.15132vw, 1.75rem); line-height: 1.3; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;" id="point-to-point-ethernet-connection">Point-to-point Ethernet connection</h3><p style="font-size: 16px; text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;">Point-to-point ethernet connection refers to using a point-to-point connection to connect your facility to the Microsoft cloud.</p><h3 style="text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 30px 0px 18px; padding: 0px; font-size: clamp(1.3125rem, 15.4737px + 1.15132vw, 1.75rem); line-height: 1.3; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;" id="any-to-any-networks">Any-to-any networks</h3><p style="font-size: 16px; text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;">With any-to-any connectivity, you can integrate your wide area network (WAN) with Azure by providing connections to your offices and datacenters. Azure integrates with your WAN connection to provide a connection like you would have between your datacenter and any branch offices.</p><h3 style="text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 30px 0px 18px; padding: 0px; font-size: clamp(1.3125rem, 15.4737px + 1.15132vw, 1.75rem); line-height: 1.3; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;" id="directly-from-expressroute-sites">Directly from ExpressRoute sites</h3><p style="font-size: 16px; text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;">You can connect directly into the Microsoft's global network at a peering location strategically distributed across the world. ExpressRoute Direct provides dual 100 Gbps or 10-Gbps connectivity, which supports Active/Active connectivity at scale.</p><h2 style="text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 32px 0px 12px; padding: 0px; font-size: clamp(1.59375rem, 18.7895px + 1.39803vw, 2.125rem); line-height: 1.3; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;" id="security-considerations">Security considerations</h2><p style="font-size: 16px; text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;">With ExpressRoute, your data doesn't travel over the public internet, reducing the risks associated with internet communications. ExpressRoute is a private connection from your on-premises infrastructure to your Azure infrastructure. Even if you have an ExpressRoute connection, DNS queries, certificate revocation list checking, and Azure Content Delivery Network requests are still sent over the public internet.</p></div>" style="text;html=1;whiteSpace=wrap;overflow=hidden;rounded=0;fontFamily=Helvetica;fontSize=11;fontColor=default;labelBackgroundColor=default;strokeWidth=6;fillColor=none;strokeColor=default;perimeterSpacing=14;align=center;" vertex="1" parent="1"> <mxGeometry x="1551" y="212" width="270" height="4157" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="thJnnxPs0yN4tjYQE-aY-111" value="<p style="font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; text-decoration: none; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;">&nbsp;Azure DNS</p><p style="font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; text-decoration: none; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;">&nbsp;a hosting service for DNS domains that provides name resolution by using Microsoft Azure infrastructure. By hosting your domains in Azure, you can manage your DNS records using the same credentials, APIs, tools, and billing as your other Azure services.</p><h2 style="font-style: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; letter-spacing: normal; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; text-decoration: none; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 32px 0px 12px; padding: 0px; font-size: clamp(1.59375rem, 18.7895px + 1.39803vw, 2.125rem); font-weight: 600; line-height: 1.3; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;" id="benefits-of-azure-dns">Benefits of Azure DNS</h2><p style="font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; text-decoration: none; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;">Azure DNS uses the scope and scale of Microsoft Azure to provide numerous benefits, including:</p><ul style="font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; text-decoration: none; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 16px 0px 16px 38px; padding: 0px; list-style: none; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;"><li style="box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; outline-style: none; outline-width: 0px; list-style: outside;">Reliability and performance</li><li style="box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; outline-style: none; outline-width: 0px; list-style: outside;">Security</li><li style="box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; outline-style: none; outline-width: 0px; list-style: outside;">Ease of Use</li><li style="box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; outline-style: none; outline-width: 0px; list-style: outside;">Customizable virtual networks</li><li style="box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; outline-style: none; outline-width: 0px; list-style: outside;">Alias records</li></ul><h3 style="font-style: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; letter-spacing: normal; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; text-decoration: none; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 30px 0px 18px; padding: 0px; font-size: clamp(1.3125rem, 15.4737px + 1.15132vw, 1.75rem); font-weight: 600; line-height: 1.3; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;" id="reliability-and-performance">Reliability and performance</h3><p style="font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; text-decoration: none; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;">DNS domains in Azure DNS are hosted on Azure's global network of DNS name servers, providing resiliency and high availability. Azure DNS uses anycast networking, so the closest available DNS server answers each DNS query, providing fast performance and high availability for your domain.</p><h3 style="font-style: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; letter-spacing: normal; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; text-decoration: none; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 30px 0px 18px; padding: 0px; font-size: clamp(1.3125rem, 15.4737px + 1.15132vw, 1.75rem); font-weight: 600; line-height: 1.3; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;" id="security">Security</h3><p style="font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; text-decoration: none; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;">Azure DNS is based on Azure Resource Manager, which provides features such as:</p><ul style="font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; text-decoration: none; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 16px 0px 16px 38px; padding: 0px; list-style: none; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;"><li style="box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; outline-style: none; outline-width: 0px; list-style: outside;">Azure role-based access control (Azure RBAC) to control who has access to specific actions for your organization.</li><li style="box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; outline-style: none; outline-width: 0px; list-style: outside;">Activity logs to monitor how a user in your organization modified a resource or to find an error when troubleshooting.</li><li style="box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; outline-style: none; outline-width: 0px; list-style: outside;">Resource locking to lock a subscription, resource group, or resource. Locking prevents other users in your organization from accidentally deleting or modifying critical resources.</li></ul><h3 style="font-style: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; letter-spacing: normal; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; text-decoration: none; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 30px 0px 18px; padding: 0px; font-size: clamp(1.3125rem, 15.4737px + 1.15132vw, 1.75rem); font-weight: 600; line-height: 1.3; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;" id="ease-of-use">Ease of use</h3><p style="font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; text-decoration: none; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;">Azure DNS can manage DNS records for your Azure services and provide DNS for your external resources as well. Azure DNS is integrated in the Azure portal and uses the same credentials, support contract, and billing as your other Azure services.</p><p style="font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; text-decoration: none; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;">Because Azure DNS is running on Azure, it means you can manage your domains and records with the Azure portal, Azure PowerShell cmdlets, and the cross-platform Azure CLI. Applications that require automated DNS management can integrate with the service by using the REST API and SDKs.</p><h3 style="font-style: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; letter-spacing: normal; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; text-decoration: none; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 30px 0px 18px; padding: 0px; font-size: clamp(1.3125rem, 15.4737px + 1.15132vw, 1.75rem); font-weight: 600; line-height: 1.3; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;" id="customizable-virtual-networks-with-private-domains">Customizable virtual networks with private domains</h3><p style="font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; text-decoration: none; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;">Azure DNS also supports private DNS domains. This feature allows you to use your own custom domain names in your private virtual networks, rather than being stuck with the Azure-provided names.</p><h3 style="font-style: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; letter-spacing: normal; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; text-decoration: none; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 30px 0px 18px; padding: 0px; font-size: clamp(1.3125rem, 15.4737px + 1.15132vw, 1.75rem); font-weight: 600; line-height: 1.3; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;" id="alias-records">Alias records</h3><p style="font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; text-decoration: none; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;">Azure DNS also supports alias record sets. You can use an alias record set to refer to an Azure resource, such as an Azure public IP address, an Azure Traffic Manager profile, or an Azure Content Delivery Network (CDN) endpoint. If the IP address of the underlying resource changes, the alias record set seamlessly updates itself during DNS resolution. The alias record set points to the service instance, and the service instance is associated with an IP address.</p><div style="font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; text-decoration: none; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: var(--theme-text); background-color: var(--theme-primary-background); overflow-wrap: break-word; word-break: break-word; border: 1px solid var(--theme-primary-background-glow-high-contrast); border-radius: 0.375rem; margin-top: 1rem; padding: 1rem; transition: height 0.5s ease-in, opacity 0.5s ease-in; display: block; position: relative; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, SegoeUI, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;" class="alert is-primary"><p style="box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%; overflow-wrap: break-word; font-weight: 600;" class="alert-title"><span style="box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; font-family: docons; font-size: inherit; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; text-transform: none; text-align: center; direction: ltr; -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased; font-style: normal; font-weight: 400; line-height: 16px; display: inline-block;" aria-hidden="true" class="docon docon-status-info-outline"></span><span class="Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>Important</p><p style="box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%; overflow-wrap: break-word;">You can't use Azure DNS to buy a domain name. For an annual fee, you can buy a domain name by using App Service domains or a third-party domain name registrar. Once purchased, your domains can be hosted in Azure DNS for record management.</p></div>" style="text;html=1;whiteSpace=wrap;overflow=hidden;rounded=0;fontFamily=Helvetica;fontSize=11;fontColor=default;labelBackgroundColor=default;strokeWidth=6;fillColor=none;strokeColor=default;perimeterSpacing=14;align=center;" vertex="1" parent="1"> <mxGeometry x="1897" y="210" width="270" height="2267" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> </root> </mxGraphModel> </diagram> </mxfile>

span.span: Divide IP address space into
subnets and allocate part of the defined
address space to each named subnet.For
name resolution, you can use the name
resolution service built into Azure. You also
can configure the virtual network to use
either an internal or an external DNS server.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 268px; height: 1px; padding-top: 405px; margin-left: 5px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left; max-height: 96px; overflow: hidden;

display: inline-block; font-size: 11px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

span.style: caret-color: rgb(31, 31, 31); color: rgb(31, 31, 31); font-family: Verdana; font-size: 12px; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: rgb(251, 251, 251);

span.span: You can enable incoming
connections from the internet by
assigning a public IP address to
an Azure resource, or putting
the resource behind a public
load balancer.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 268px; height: 1px; padding-top: 575px; margin-left: 5px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left; max-height: 200px; overflow: hidden;

display: inline-block; font-size: 11px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

span.style: caret-color: rgb(31, 31, 31); color: rgb(31, 31, 31); font-family: Verdana; font-size: 12px; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: rgb(251, 251, 251);

span.span: Virtual networks can connect not only VMs but other Azure
resources, such as the App Service Environment for Power
Apps, Azure Kubernetes Service, and Azure virtual machine
scale sets.
2. Service endpoints can connect to other Azure resource
types, such as Azure SQL databases and storage accounts.
This approach enables you to link multiple Azure resources
to virtual networks to improve security and provide optimal
routing between resources.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 268px; height: 1px; padding-top: 837px; margin-left: 5px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left; max-height: 366px; overflow: hidden;

display: inline-block; font-size: 11px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

span.style: caret-color: rgb(31, 31, 31); color: rgb(31, 31, 31); font-family: Verdana; font-size: 12px; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: rgb(251, 251, 251);
caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: "Segoe UI", SegoeUI, "Helvetica Neue", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

p.span: 1. Point-to-site virtual private network connections are from a computer outside your organization back into your corporate network. In this case, the client computer initiates an encrypted VPN connection to connect to the Azure virtual network.

font.face: Segoe UI, SegoeUI, Helvetica Neue, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif

span.style: caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: "Segoe UI", SegoeUI, "Helvetica Neue", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px;

span.span: 2. Site-to-site virtual private networks link your on-premises VPN device or gateway to the Azure VPN gateway in a virtual network. In effect, the devices in Azure can appear as being on the local network. The connection is encrypted and works over the internet.

font.face: Segoe UI, SegoeUI, Helvetica Neue, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif

span.style: caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: "Segoe UI", SegoeUI, "Helvetica Neue", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px;

span.span: 3. Azure ExpressRoute provides a dedicated private connectivity to Azure that doesn't travel over the internet. ExpressRoute is useful for environments where you need greater bandwidth and even higher levels of security.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 248px; height: 1px; padding-top: 10px; margin-left: 499px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left; max-height: 46px; overflow: hidden;

display: inline-block; font-size: 11px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

span.style: caret-color: rgb(31, 31, 31); color: rgb(31, 31, 31); font-family: Verdana; font-size: 12px; text-align: center; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: rgb(251, 251, 251);

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 268px; height: 1px; padding-top: 197px; margin-left: 486px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left; max-height: 249px; overflow: hidden;

display: inline-block; font-size: 11px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

span.style: caret-color: rgb(31, 31, 31); color: rgb(31, 31, 31); font-family: Verdana; font-size: 12px; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: rgb(251, 251, 251);

p.style: box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: "Segoe UI", SegoeUI, "Helvetica Neue", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;
p.font: 1. Azure virtual networks enable you to filter traffic between subnets by using the following approaches:

p.style: box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: "Segoe UI", SegoeUI, "Helvetica Neue", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;

div.p: 2.Network security groups are Azure resources that can contain multiple inbound and outbound security rules. You can define these rules to allow or block traffic, based on factors such as source and destination IP address, port, and protocol.

p.style: box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: "Segoe UI", SegoeUI, "Helvetica Neue", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;

div.p: 3.Network virtual appliances are specialized VMs that can be compared to a hardened network appliance. A network virtual appliance carries out a particular network function, such as running a firewall or performing wide area network (WAN) optimization.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 268px; height: 1px; padding-top: 509px; margin-left: 486px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left; max-height: 260px; overflow: hidden;

display: inline-block; font-size: 11px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

span.style: caret-color: rgb(31, 31, 31); color: rgb(31, 31, 31); font-family: Verdana; font-size: 12px; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: rgb(251, 251, 251);

p.style: box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: "Segoe UI", SegoeUI, "Helvetica Neue", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12px;
p.font: 1. Azure routes traffic between subnets on any connected virtual networks, on-premises networks, and the internet. You also can control routing and override those settings, as follows:

p.style: box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: "Segoe UI", SegoeUI, "Helvetica Neue", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12px;

div.p: 2. Route tables allow you to define rules about how traffic should be directed. You can create custom route tables that control how packets are routed between subnets.

p.style: box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: "Segoe UI", SegoeUI, "Helvetica Neue", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12px;

div.p: 3. Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) works with Azure VPN gateways, Azure Route Server, or Azure ExpressRoute to propagate on-premises BGP routes to Azure virtual networks.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 268px; height: 1px; padding-top: 837px; margin-left: 489px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left; max-height: 291px; overflow: hidden;

display: inline-block; font-size: 11px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

span.style: caret-color: rgb(31, 31, 31); font-size: 12px; white-space-collapse: preserve; background-color: rgb(251, 251, 251);

p.style: box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: "Segoe UI", SegoeUI, "Helvetica Neue", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12px;
p.font: You can link virtual networks together by using virtual network peering. Peering allows two virtual networks to connect directly to each other. Network traffic between peered networks is private, and travels on the Microsoft backbone network, never entering the public internet. Peering enables resources in each virtual network to communicate with each other. These virtual networks can be in separate regions. This feature allows you to create a global interconnected network through Azure.

p.style: box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: "Segoe UI", SegoeUI, "Helvetica Neue", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12px;
p.font: User-defined routes (UDR) allow you to control the routing tables between subnets within a virtual network or between virtual networks. This allows for greater control over network traffic flow.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 268px; height: 1px; padding-top: 195px; margin-left: 974px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center; max-height: 311px; overflow: hidden;

display: inline-block; font-size: 11px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

p.style: font-size: 11px; text-align: left; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: "Segoe UI", SegoeUI, "Helvetica Neue", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;
p.span: A virtual private network (VPN) uses an encrypted tunnel within another network. VPNs are typically deployed to connect two or more trusted private networks to one another over an untrusted network (typically the public internet). Traffic is encrypted while traveling over the untrusted network to prevent eavesdropping or other attacks. VPNs can enable networks to safely and securely share sensitive information.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 268px; height: 1px; padding-top: 580px; margin-left: 974px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center; max-height: 2139px; overflow: hidden;

display: inline-block; font-size: 11px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

p.style: text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word;

font.p: A VPN gateway is a type of virtual network gateway. Azure VPN Gateway instances are deployed in a dedicated subnet of the virtual network and enable the following connectivity:

ul.style: text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 16px 0px 16px 38px; padding: 0px; list-style: none;

li.style: box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; outline-style: none; outline-width: 0px; list-style: outside;

ul.li: Connect on-premises datacenters to virtual networks through a site-to-site connection.

li.style: box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; outline-style: none; outline-width: 0px; list-style: outside;

ul.li: Connect individual devices to virtual networks through a point-to-site connection.

li.style: box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; outline-style: none; outline-width: 0px; list-style: outside;

ul.li: Connect virtual networks to other virtual networks through a network-to-network connection.

p.style: text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word;

font.p: All data transfer is encrypted inside a private tunnel as it crosses the internet. You can deploy only one VPN gateway in each virtual network. However, you can use one gateway to connect to multiple locations, which includes other virtual networks or on-premises datacenters.

p.style: text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word;

font.p: When setting up a VPN gateway, you must specify the type of VPN - either policy-based or route-based. The primary distinction between these two types is how they determine which traffic needs encryption. In Azure, regardless of the VPN type, the method of authentication employed is a preshared key.

ul.style: text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 16px 0px 16px 38px; padding: 0px; list-style: none;

li.style: box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; outline-style: none; outline-width: 0px; list-style: outside;

ul.li: Policy-based VPN gateways specify statically the IP address of packets that should be encrypted through each tunnel. This type of device evaluates every data packet against those sets of IP addresses to choose the tunnel where that packet is going to be sent through.

li.style: box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; outline-style: none; outline-width: 0px; list-style: outside;

ul.li: In Route-based gateways, IPSec tunnels are modeled as a network interface or virtual tunnel interface. IP routing (either static routes or dynamic routing protocols) decides which one of these tunnel interfaces to use when sending each packet. Route-based VPNs are the preferred connection method for on-premises devices. They're more resilient to topology changes such as the creation of new subnets.

p.style: text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word;

font.p: Use a route-based VPN gateway if you need any of the following types of connectivity:

ul.style: text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 16px 0px 16px 38px; padding: 0px; list-style: none;

li.style: box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; outline-style: none; outline-width: 0px; list-style: outside;

ul.li: Connections between virtual networks

li.style: box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; outline-style: none; outline-width: 0px; list-style: outside;

ul.li: Point-to-site connections

li.style: box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; outline-style: none; outline-width: 0px; list-style: outside;

ul.li: Multisite connections

li.style: box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; outline-style: none; outline-width: 0px; list-style: outside;

ul.li: Coexistence with an Azure ExpressRoute gateway

h2.style: text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 32px 0px 12px; padding: 0px; font-size: clamp(1.59375rem, 18.7895px + 1.39803vw, 2.125rem); line-height: 1.3;

p.style: text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word;

font.p: If you’re configuring a VPN to keep your information safe, you also want to be sure that it’s a highly available and fault tolerant VPN configuration. There are a few ways to maximize the resiliency of your VPN gateway.

h3.style: text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 30px 0px 18px; padding: 0px; font-size: clamp(1.3125rem, 15.4737px + 1.15132vw, 1.75rem); line-height: 1.3;

p.style: text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word;

font.p: By default, VPN gateways are deployed as two instances in an active/standby configuration, even if you only see one VPN gateway resource in Azure. When planned maintenance or unplanned disruption affects the active instance, the standby instance automatically assumes responsibility for connections without any user intervention. Connections are interrupted during this failover, but they typically restore within a few seconds for planned maintenance and within 90 seconds for unplanned disruptions.

h3.style: text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 30px 0px 18px; padding: 0px; font-size: clamp(1.3125rem, 15.4737px + 1.15132vw, 1.75rem); line-height: 1.3;

p.style: text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word;

font.p: With the introduction of support for the BGP routing protocol, you can also deploy VPN gateways in an active/active configuration. In this configuration, you assign a unique public IP address to each instance. You then create separate tunnels from the on-premises device to each IP address. You can extend the high availability by deploying an additional VPN device on-premises.

h3.style: text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 30px 0px 18px; padding: 0px; font-size: clamp(1.3125rem, 15.4737px + 1.15132vw, 1.75rem); line-height: 1.3;

p.style: text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word;

font.p: Another high-availability option is to configure a VPN gateway as a secure failover path for ExpressRoute connections. ExpressRoute circuits have resiliency built in. However, they aren't immune to physical problems that affect the cables delivering connectivity or outages that affect the complete ExpressRoute location. In high-availability scenarios, where there's risk associated with an outage of an ExpressRoute circuit, you can also provision a VPN gateway that uses the internet as an alternative method of connectivity. In this way, you can ensure there's always a connection to the virtual networks.

h3.style: text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 30px 0px 18px; padding: 0px; font-size: clamp(1.3125rem, 15.4737px + 1.15132vw, 1.75rem); line-height: 1.3;

p.style: text-align: start; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word;

font.p: In regions that support availability zones, VPN gateways and ExpressRoute gateways can be deployed in a zone-redundant configuration. This configuration brings resiliency, scalability, and higher availability to virtual network gateways. Deploying gateways in Azure availability zones physically and logically separates gateways within a region while protecting your on-premises network connectivity to Azure from zone-level failures. These gateways require different gateway stock keeping units (SKUs) and use Standard public IP addresses instead of Basic public IP addresses.

p.style: font-size: 11px; text-align: left; box-sizing: inherit; outline-color: inherit; margin: 1rem 0px 0px; padding: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word; caret-color: rgb(230, 230, 230); font-family: "Segoe UI", SegoeUI, "Helvetica Neue", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;
